title: Transfer news: The latest rumours from Man Utd, Chelsea, Arsenal and all the top teams
text:
0 19-Mar-2017 05:15:00 Goal summarises the biggest transfer talk from the Premier League, La Liga, Serie A, the Bundesliga and beyond ARSENAL WANT BARKLEY 
Arsenal have joined the race to sign wantaway Everton attacker Ross Barkley, according to the Daily Mirror . 
The England international, 22, will be sold by the Toffees this summer if he does not sign a new contract with the club. 
Chelsea and Tottenham are among the other Premier League teams believed to be keen to snap up Barkley should he leave Goodison Park. INTER & SEVILLA WANT SON 
Inter and Sevilla have both made enquiries regarding the availability of Tottenham forward Heung-Min Son, according to the Evening Standard . 
The South Korea international is currently enjoying his best season at White Hart Lane but could be tempted away by the promise of more regular football. UNITED & MADRID WANT SCHMEICHEL 
Real Madrid have added Leicester City's Kasper Schmeichel to the goalkeeping shortlist for the summer, according to Don Balon . 
Los Blancos have been impressed with the Dane's performances in the Champions League this season, though they could face competition from Manchester United. INTER OFFER CONTE HUGE CONTRACT 
Inter are set to offer Chelsea manager Antonio Conte a £13 millon-a-year deal in a bid to lure him to San Siro, according to The Sun . 
Such a contract would see the former Juventus manager double his current wages, with the Serie A outfit willing to hand him full control of transfers should he join. CITY TURN TO RUDIGER 
Manchester City are hopeful of completing a £30 million deal to sign Roma defender Antonio Rudiger, according to the Daily Mirror . 
City have scouted the Germany international extensively, though they could face competition from Chelsea for his signature. ARSENAL PLOT KEITA MOVE 
Arsenal are plotting a summer move for RB Leipzig midfielder Naby Keita, according to SportBild . 
The Bundesliga outfit are unlikely to sell for less than £26 million, with Bayern Munich also monitoring the player's progress. REAL MADRID WATCH DE GEA AND COURTOIS 
Real Madrid's transfer chief Juni Calafat was present at the FA Cuo quarter-final match between Chelsea and Manchester United on Monday in order to scout goalkeepers David de Gea and Thibaut Courtois, according to Marca . 
De Gea has been a long-rumoured target of Madrid with a transfer falling through at the deadline in 2015. Courtois, who has starred for Real's rival Atletico while on loan from Chelsea, is reportedly also held in high regard by Los Blancos. KIMMICH TOPS PEP'S SHORTLIST 
Bayern Munich midfielder Joshua Kimmich is top of Pep Guardiola's summer transfer shortlist, according to The Sun . 
Guardiola is set to overhaul his squad this summer, with up to 15 players being allowed to leave the Etihad Stadium. 
And the Catalan coach wants Kimmich - who can also play in defence - to head up £200 million worth of arrivals ahead of next season. SAINTS PLOT HART BID 
Southampton are considering a summer move for Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart, according to the Daily Mail . 
Current Saints No.1 Fraser Forster is a target for Everton, and Claude Puel is hopeful Hart - who has spent the season on loan at Torino - could be brought in as a replacement. SPURS EYE BARKLEY & ZAHA 
Tottenham are planning summer moves for Everton midfielder Ross Barkley and Crystal Palace winger Wilfried Zaha, according to the Daily Mirror . 
Mauricio Pochettino is a long-term admirer of both players and is keen to add them to his young squad ahead of next season. MAN CITY TARGET NAVAS 
Manchester City are set to target Real Madrid goalkeeper Keylor Navas this summer, according to AS . 
Pep Guardiola is willing to sell Claudio Bravo this summer, and the former Barcelona boss is eyeing the Costa Rica international as Bravo's replacement. MAN CITY TO RELEASE 18 PLAYERS 
Pep Guardiola is set to oversee a massive restructuring of his squad at Manchester City and could see 18 players leave after this season, according to The Guardian . 
With many players out of contract at the end of the season, several on loan and others out of favour, the Premier League side are likely to wave goodbye to a large list of players. 
Yaya Toure, Gael Clichy, Pablo Zabaleta, Willy Caballero, Jesus Navas, Bacary Sagna and Tosin Adarabioyo are all nearing the end of their contracts. Loanees Joe Hart, Eliaquim Mangala, Samir Nasri, Wilfried Bony and Jason Denayer could also leave, while there is uncertainty over the futures of Sergio Aguero, Vincent Kompany, Aleksandar Kolarov, Fabian Delph, Fernando and Kelechi Iheanacho. 
Guardiola will then get around £150 million to spend to rebuild a team after the horror of their last-16 Champions League elimination at the hands of Monaco. DONNARUMMA TO SNUB MADRID 
Gianluigi Donnarumma is set to ignore interest from Real Madrid in order to extend his stay at AC Milan, Corriere dello Sport reports. 
The 18-year-old goalkeeper is seen as one of Europe's most promising young players and the uncertainty over his future has prompted links to some of Europe's top sides. Madrid are looking for a long-term replacement for Iker Casillas and president Florentino Perez wants the Italian. 
Madrid are willing to match his wage demands, but Donnarumma would rather stay at San Siro and Adriano Galliani will oblige. LIVERPOOL & BAYERN IN BRANDT BATTLE 
Bayer Leverkusen winger Julian Brandt is expected to be the subject of a bidding war in the near future, according to the Daily Mirror , with Bayern Munich and Liverpool waiting to pounce at the end of the season. 
The Reds' interest in the Germany international is no secret and Jurgen Klopp is preparing an offer for the £20 million-rated player but it is reported that he has already opened talks with the German champions. CHELSEA LINE UP LUKAKU & BARKLEY 
Chelsea are set to make a double swoop on Everton for Ross Barkley and Romelu Lukaku, according to the Telegraph . 
Reports claim that Lukaku is keen to return to his former club, while Barkley is a long-term target at Stamford Bridge. 
Together, the pair could set the Blues back as much as £100 million if they convince Everton to sell their two stars. BARCELONA TO MAKE NEW DEMBELE APPROACH 
Barcelona are determined to land Ousmane Dembele after losing out to Dortmund last summer, according to Mundo Deportivo . 
The Catalans saw efforts to sign the talented teenager fall short in 2016, but are preparing a fresh approach to convince BVB to let go of their star. LIVERPOOL INTERESTED IN WERNER 
Liverpool are keeping close tabs on young RB Leipzig striker Timo Werner, according to the Daily Mail . 
The 21-year-old has made a big impact since signing from Stuttgart, and those efforts have not gone unnoticed with Jurgen Klopp impressed with his performances in the Bundesliga. MATIC OFFERED TO BARCELONA 
Chelsea midfielder Nemanja Matic has been offered to Barcelona, according to Mundo Deportivo . 
The Camp Nou outfit are looking for a long-term replacement for Sergio Busquets, and the Serbia international fits that bill. 
Chelsea are looking to renew Matic's contract, but the player's representatives are looking to offer him to other clubs in a bid to gain a better deal. MADRID IDENTIFY PEPE REPLACEMENT Real Madrid are targeting Porto centre-back Felipe Monteiro as a replacement for Pepe, claims AS . The club have been in contact with Monteiro's entourage and a verbal deal is in place for him to move to the Bernabeu next season. Porto's need to sell to balance their books should facilitate a transfer of between €25 million to €30m - significantly less than the Brazilian's mininum fee release clause of €50m. MADRID LINKED WITH LENO 
Bayer Leverkusen goalkeeper Bernd Leno has been added to Real Madrid's list of potential replacements for Keylor Navas, Fichajes.net reports. 
At 25 years old, Leno recently confirmed that he can 'aspire to new heights', and represents a cheaper option than Premier League shot-stoppers David De Gea and Thibaut Courtois. Related
